content: essential boot socks this free pattern can serve as a guide for three common methods for knitting a sock heel going into this project i had only done the classic heel flap method myself but i had wanted to learn some new techniques for a long time both the short row and afterthought heels proved very easy to pick up and i was so excited to learn them that i just had to pass on the love here i present these three methods for a sock heel including the heel flap the short row heel and the afterthought heel for cuff-down socks with detailed instructions and visuals for each method i hope you enjoy knitting them as much as i did in this pattern i also included one of my favorite design elements the permanently folded cuff edge while it is optional this technique provides a firmer sock cuff preventing the socks from sliding down your leg it is worked by first using a provisional cast-on to give you live stitches at the cast on edge and later joining the live stitches at this edge to the live stitches on your needles notes dimensions finished foot circumference of 7 8 9 or 17 75 20 25 23 cm around the widest part of your foot  if you are between sizes you may work a size up for roomier socks or size down for more fitted socks needles  size us 1/2 25 mm dpns or long circular needles for magic loop  size us 2/2 75 mm dpns or long circular needles for magic loop 
